poem:
Title: "In the Corridors of Power"

Hard-right stand in the fiscal rail,
may they plea or may they fail?
Strains on the Capitol, the bill's tale,
can democracy stitch, or will it frail?

Border lines drawn in harsh negotiation,
an echo of a divided nation.
In the halls of powers' creation,
awakes the dread of decimation.
